text:
I am unable to index into a 3-dimensional array with multiple cartesian indices:
```julia> A = rand(Int8, 3, 3, 3);

julia> A[CartesianIndex[CartesianIndex(1, 1, 1), CartesianIndex(3, 3, 3)]]
ERROR: ArgumentError: unable to check bounds for indices of type CartesianIndex{3}```
However this works when I remove the `CartesianIndex` type from the array:
```julia> A[[CartesianIndex(1, 1, 1), CartesianIndex(3, 3, 3)]]
2-element Array{Int8,1}:
 44
  2```
Any idea why this is?

elements.text: I am unable to index into a 3-dimensional array with multiple cartesian indices:
However this works when I remove the

text: Sorry, I figured it out.  Instead of writing `CartesianIndex[...]` I need to write `CartesianIndex{3}[...]` :face_palm:
